_note: This is a sample configuration file, values with '_' will be ignored
_ports1: The ports are used for the server, the first port is used for HTTP, the second for HTTPS
_ports2: This will be reworked in the future to support multiple ports, while unused, fill in the seperate port configs for future compatibility
_ports3: Do not enter more then 2 ports here, it WILL break the server, see note 2 above
_unconfiguredCloseNoResponse: If enabled, the server will instantly close the connection instead of responding with 421 Misdirected Request
_teapot: if you don't like this server to brew coffee, you can enable the teapot status code, its the same as maintenance mode, but as a joke

management._note: Management interface is not yet implemented, it will include a web interface similar to Nginx Proxy Manager (hopefully)
management._accounts: Currently only one account is supported, more will be added in the future

testserver._note: This is a test server, it will respond with a 200 OK, if enabled
testserver._fail: if enabled, the test server will not respond causing a timeout

acme._note: this client does not seem too reliable, use certbot or acme.sh instead if possible
acme._terms: From the directory link, you will find the terms of service, you need to agree to them before using the acme client
acme._email: change this to your email address

_ssl._note: This is the default ssl configuration for acme, ca is optional (keep empty if unused like this: 'ca: []' )

ssl._note: While I'm developing this, I'm using my own domain, you should change this to your own domain

_proxy: Define your proxy rules here, the following is an example

stub._note: This is the response config for any errors, do not remove this
